channel.title: integration on The Amateur Data Scientist
channel.description: Recent content in integration on The Amateur Data Scientist

item.title: Areas of Bounded Regions
item.description: 1 Problems 1.1 Region in the Second Quadrant 1.2 Cubic Curve and Tangent 2 Solutions 2.1 Horizontal Strip 2.2 Between the Lines 3 Code for Plots 4 Reference 1 Problems 1.1 Region in the Second Quadrant Problem 17, page 255 in Simmons (2016) Find the area of the region in the second quadrant bounded by the \(x\)-axis and the parabolas \(y = x^2\) and \(y = \sqrt{x + 18}\).

item.title: Rain Drops: Condensation and Acceleration
item.description: 1 Problem 2 Solution 3 Reference 1 Problem Problem 49, page 189 in Simmons (2016) Newtonâ€™s second law of motion \[ F = ma = m \frac{dv}{dt} \] can be written in the form \[ \begin{equation} F = \frac{d \left( mv \right)}{dt} \tag{1.1} \end{equation} \] in terms of the momentum \(mv\) of a particle of mass \(m\) and velocity \(v\), and remains valid even if \(m\) is not constant.
